item.title: Jillian add a quote by Randolph Bourne
item.description: "The world has never favored the experimental life. It despises poets, fanatics, prophets and lovers." -- Randolph Bourne

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "A little love, a little buckshot, that's how I'd say handle yourself." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Oh, now, now, now, the only now, and above all now, and there is no other now but thou now and now is thy prophet." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "I feel horrible. She doesn't / love me and I wander around / the house like a sewing machine / that's just finished sewing / a turd to a garbage can lid." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Ernesto Sábato
item.description: "Greatness is so aggressive, so dramatic! Don't you think it is almost bad manners?" -- Ernesto Sábato

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "You ride well, but you don't kiss nicely at all." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Patricia Highsmith
item.description: "I had depressing thoughts that the theme, even though I had thought of it, was better than I was as a writer. Henry James or Thomas Mann could easily write it, but not I. 'I'm thinking of writing it from the point of view of someone at the hotel who observes her,' I said, but this did not fill me with much hope. Then my friend, who is not a writer, suggested I try it from the omniscient author's point of view." -- Patricia Highsmith

item.title: Jillian add a quote by John O'Hara
item.description: "There comes a time in a man's life, if he is unlucky and leads a full life, when he has a secret so dirty that he knows he never will get rid of it. (Shakespeare knew this and tried to say it, but he said it just as badly as anyone ever said it. 'All the perfumes of Arabia' makes you think of all the perfumes of Arabia and nothing more. It is the trouble with all metaphors where human behavior is concerned. People are not ships, chess men, flowers, race horses, oil paintings, bottles of champagne, excrement, musical instruments or anything else but people. Metaphors are all right to give you an idea.)" -- John O'Hara

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Amiri Baraka
item.description: "from the slave ship to the citizenship we faced a lot of bullship" -- Amiri Baraka

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Sarah Schulman
item.description: "You’re not user-friendly. You’re too needy. You have no social currency. You’re a freak. Without a normative side, you can’t get in. That’s it. Sorry." -- Sarah Schulman

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "It is rare and almost impossible for a novel to have only one narrator." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Elfriede Jelinek
item.description: "you have often seen in the cinema, erich, haven't you, that between extraordinary people extraordinary things like for example extraordinary love can arise. so we only have to be extraordinary and see what happens." -- Elfriede Jelinek

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Karen Armstrong
item.description: "Jewish, Christian, and Muslim theologians have insisted for centuries that God does not exist and that there is 'nothing' out there; in making these assertions, their aim was not to deny the reality of God but to safeguard God's transcendence." -- Karen Armstrong

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Augusto Monterroso
item.description: "When he woke up, the dinosaur was still there." -- Augusto Monterroso

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Julio Cortazar trans. Paul Blackburn
item.description: "Andrea, I didn't want to come live in your apartment in the calle Suipacha." -- Julio Cortazar trans. Paul Blackburn

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Jean Toomer
item.description: "You are the most sleepiest man I ever seed." -- Jean Toomer

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Nathanael West
item.description: "Let him ride a horse. He's a cowboy ain't he?" -- Nathanael West

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "How should I know why! I didn't invent human beings, Iggy." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Eudora Welty
item.description: "Suppose you meet me in the woods." -- Eudora Welty

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Her old thoughts were going to come in handy now, but new words would have to be made and said to fit them." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Jillian add a quote by Leslie Marmon Silko
item.description: "You damn your own soul better than I ever could." -- Leslie Marmon Silko
